name.fi: Operations and Supply Chain Analytics, Luento-opetus
name.en: Operations and Supply Chain Analytics, Lecture

workload.fi: Lectures, independent and group work, and exam.
workload.sv: Lectures, independent and group work, and exam.
workload.en: Lectures, independent and group work, and exam.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: This course will build on the basics of operations management, statistics, and optimization. In particular, it is strongly recommended that students have completed the following courses: - ISM-A3002 Tuotannon ja palveluiden johtaminen (Operations and service management), - ISM-C1002 Tilastotieteen ja data-analytiikan jatkokurssi (Advanced course in statistics and data analytics), - ISM-C1004 Business Analytics 1, or obtained equivalent skills from other university-level courses. These skills include the basics of linear algebra, multivariate functions, probability and random variables, regression models, and linear optimization. Experience with a programming language such as R or Python will be useful.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: This course will build on the basics of operations management, statistics, and optimization. In particular, it is strongly recommended that students have completed the following courses: - ISM-A3002 Tuotannon ja palveluiden johtaminen (Operations and service management), - ISM-C1002 Tilastotieteen ja data-analytiikan jatkokurssi (Advanced course in statistics and data analytics), - ISM-C1004 Business Analytics 1, or obtained equivalent skills from other university-level courses. These skills include the basics of linear algebra, multivariate functions, probability and random variables, regression models, and linear optimization. Experience with a programming language such as R or Python will be useful.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: This course will build on the basics of operations management, statistics, and optimization. In particular, it is strongly recommended that students have completed the following courses: - ISM-A3002 Tuotannon ja palveluiden johtaminen (Operations and service management), - ISM-C1002 Tilastotieteen ja data-analytiikan jatkokurssi (Advanced course in statistics and data analytics), - ISM-C1004 Business Analytics 1, or obtained equivalent skills from other university-level courses. These skills include the basics of linear algebra, multivariate functions, probability and random variables, regression models, and linear optimization. Experience with a programming language such as R or Python will be useful.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The operations function of an organization is responsible for delivering products to match supply with demand. This course provides students with core analytical concepts and tools to improve an organization's operational decision-making.
After the course, students will understand common issues faced by operations and supply chain managers, be able to apply analytical tools to address these problems to obtain insights, and understand the role and limits of analytics in improving operational decision-making.

After the course, students will understand common issues faced by operations and supply chain managers, be able to apply analytical tools to address these problems to obtain insights, and understand the role and limits of analytics in improving operational decision-making.
learningOutcomes.en:
The operations function of an organization is responsible for delivering products to match supply with demand. This course provides students with core analytical concepts and tools to improve an organization's operational decision-making.
After the course, students will understand common issues faced by operations and supply chain managers, be able to apply analytical tools to address these problems to obtain insights, and understand the role and limits of analytics in improving operational decision-making.

content.fi: The course will include an overview of analytics for business operations and supply chains; data-driven decision-making for capacity and inventory management; optimization in logistics; and supply chain design, with applications from e.g., retail and manufacturing.
content.sv: The course will include an overview of analytics for business operations and supply chains; data-driven decision-making for capacity and inventory management; optimization in logistics; and supply chain design, with applications from e.g., retail and manufacturing.
content.en: The course will include an overview of analytics for business operations and supply chains; data-driven decision-making for capacity and inventory management; optimization in logistics; and supply chain design, with applications from e.g., retail and manufacturing.

name.en: Procurement and Strategic Sourcing D, Lecture

workload.fi: LecturesIndependent and group work Exam
workload.sv: LecturesIndependent and group work Exam
workload.en: LecturesIndependent and group work Exam

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: It is recommended that students have taken Operations Management (e.g., 35A00310 Tuotantotalous) related courses before this course. Good MS Excel skills are recommended with an understanding of regression analysis.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: It is recommended that students have taken Operations Management (e.g., 35A00310 Tuotantotalous) related courses before this course. Good MS Excel skills are recommended with an understanding of regression analysis.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: It is recommended that students have taken Operations Management (e.g., 35A00310 Tuotantotalous) related courses before this course. Good MS Excel skills are recommended with an understanding of regression analysis.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course you will possess a set of skills and knowledge that qualifies you for sourcing, purchasing and supply management jobs such as buyer, sourcing specialist, and procurement analyst. You are able to compare alternative sources of supply, develop holistic purchasing processes, and build tools for daily operative management. You also understand the impact of purchasing and supply management on firm performance.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course you will possess a set of skills and knowledge that qualifies you for sourcing, purchasing and supply management jobs such as buyer, sourcing specialist, and procurement analyst. You are able to compare alternative sources of supply, develop holistic purchasing processes, and build tools for daily operative management. You also understand the impact of purchasing and supply management on firm performance.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course you will possess a set of skills and knowledge that qualifies you for sourcing, purchasing and supply management jobs such as buyer, sourcing specialist, and procurement analyst. You are able to compare alternative sources of supply, develop holistic purchasing processes, and build tools for daily operative management. You also understand the impact of purchasing and supply management on firm performance.

content.fi: The course topics include introducing procurement, sourcing strategy, purchasing category and management, outsourcing (make or buy), contract management and processes, cost management and modeling, procurement analytics, supplier selection, supplier relationship management, as well as trends driving procurement.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course you will possess a set of skills and knowledge that qualifies you for sourcing, purchasing and supply management jobs such as buyer, sourcing specialist, and procurement analyst. You are able to compare alternative sources of supply, develop holistic purchasing processes, and build tools for daily operative management. You also understand the impact of purchasing and supply management on firm performance.

learningOutcomes.fi: The student learns about an advanced topic related to marketing. The topic varies, and is determined by the instructor. The course may focus on theory, research methods and/or practice.

content.fi:
This is an independent and self-directed learning experience. Upon the completion of this course, the student will have gained:
  • advance knowledge on a contemporary marketing topic of their choosing
  • sharper critical thinking skills
  • a deeper understanding of how analytical thinking help in the field of marketing
